creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
inscription: left: 昭和三年作　せとないかい 高濱港 {Shōwa sannen saku, Setonaikai Takahamakō} | bottom, in pencil: In the Inland Sea | H. Yoshida
life_date: Yoshida Hiroshi (self-published), Japanese, 1876–1950; Maeda Yūjirō, Carver
markings: LRC, red artist's seal I: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
title: Takahama Port on the Inland Sea
